page.title: 11Farming in Dundrennan
page.content: There are ten farms in our area.Six of these have dairies and the other four have mixed farming. The main types of dairy cattle are Fresians and Ayrshires,and the sheep are either Scottish Blackface or crossbreeds. Most land is used for rough grazing followed by grass,which is used for silage and barley. Altogether the farms have 30 tractors,the most popular being Ford and David Brown.There are also four combine harvesters. Farming is an important source of work.Of the 27 children in the school,19 of their parents are directly involved in farm work.
